Type the learning objectives for this resource.

VI Unidad: Escribamos y hablemos con corrección ortográfica y textual.

Contenido: Gramática.

Sub contenido: Oraciones Subordinadas y Coordinadas.

Objetivo: Facilitar el aprendizaje mediante el uso interactivo de una aplicación web, enfocada en mejorar la comprensión y aplicación de las reglas de gramática, particularmente en el uso de oraciones subordinadas y coordinadas.
1. Tipos y ejemplos de oraciones subordinadas

1. Oraciones subordinadas sustantivas. Nexo subordinante (por ejemplo: que, donde, cuando y cuanto) "Me alegra que hayas venido". (La oración subordinada "que hayas venido" actúa como el complemento del verbo "alegra".)

2. Oraciones subordinadas adjetivas. Nexos subordinantes: que, cual, quien, cuyo, donde, como, cuando y cuánto.  "La casa que compramos es grande". "que compramos" (modifica a "casa")

3. Existen dos tipos de oraciones subordinadas adverbiales: las propias y las impropias. Nexo subordinante: donde, cuando, como y cuanto. Por ejemplo: "Cuando llegué, el tren ya había salido". Impropias pueden ser causales, condicionales, consecutivas, concesivas, comparativas o finales. Por ejemplo: "Llegué tarde a la oficina, porque no funcionaba el subte"

1.1 Actividades de oraciones subordinadas.
ACTIVIDADES DE LAS ORACIONES SUBORDINADAS
Text and Tasks
Actividad 1 subordinada. Encuentra y completa las oraciones.
Encuentra y completa las oraciones subordinadas.
Provide instruction on how the cloze activity should be completed. Default text will be entered if there are no changes to this field.

Lea el párrafo que aparece abajo y encuentra las oraciones subordinadas. En cada oración se da un indicio de que puede tratar la oración corespondiente. El espacio en blanco se ajusta al tamaño de la oración que debera completar. Completa segun el orden de las oraciones en el parrafo.

Recuerda que al escribir las oraciones inician con mayúsculas, aplicar tildes y comas.
University of Auckland
If this option is checked, submitted answers with different capitalization will be marked as incorrect.

La película que me recomendaste es muy linda, y me hizo pensar en todas las historias que me has contado. El doctor que me dijiste es buenísimo, y gracias a su tratamiento me siento mucho mejor. Ángel, quien es mi hermano, me está visitando hoy, lo cual me alegra mucho. Sin embargo, tengo la duda de que me halla escuchado cuando le pedí que me acompañara al médico. Tengo que irme aunque quiera quedarme un poco más con él y disfrutar del día.

.

  1. La películaque me recomendaste es muy linda .
  2. El doctor que me dijiste es buenísimo .
  3. Ángel, quien es mi hermano, me está visitando hoy .
  4. Tengo la duda de que me halla escuchado.
  5. Tengo que irme aunque quiera quedarme.
If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Cloze Activity

Interactive Activities
2. Tipos y ejemplos de oraciones coordinadas

1. Coordinadas copulativas. Nexos como y, e, o ni. Por ejemplo: “Miguel juega al fútbol y al básquet”, “Tu madre no lava ni plancha”.

2. Nexos adversativos. Por ejemplo: sin embargo, pero, excepto, sino, no obstante. Se utilizan para oponer cláusulas y forman oraciones adversativas. Por ejemplo: Hoy no vendrá Pedro, sino que vendrá Javier.

3. Coordinadas disyuntivas. Nexos como o, u. Por ejemplo: “¿Miguel juega al fútbol o al básquet?

4. Coordinadas distributivas. Nexos como  ya,  ya, bien,  sea, e. Por ejemplo: “Mauricio ya juega con una cosa, ya juega con otra”.

Actividad 2 coordinada. Completa con la respuesta correcta.
Completa con la respuesta correcta

Lea y analiza las siguientes oraciones y escribe que tipo de oración coordinada es, según su nexo. Copulativos; ( y, e, ni), Adversativos; (sin embargo, pero, excepto, sino, no obstante), Disyuntivos;  (o, o bien, u), Distributivos; (bien… bien, ya… ya, unos).

If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
